derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from Latin plinthus, from Greek plinthos 'tile, brick, squared stone'. The Latin form was in early use in English

entry.def: A plinth is a rectangular block of stone on which a statue or pillar stands.

means.word_mean: 1. an architectural support or base (as for a column or statue)
